name: Tamoxifen
description: A selective estrogen receptor modulator used to treat hormone receptor-positive breast cancer.

name: Enzalutamide
description: An androgen receptor inhibitor used to treat prostate cancer.

name: FOLFOX
description: A chemotherapy regimen containing FOLinic acid, Fluorouracil, and OXaliplatin used for colorectal cancer.
dosage_info: Administered intravenously every 2 weeks for 12 cycles.

name: Pembrolizumab
description: A PD-1 inhibitor immunotherapy used to treat various cancers including non-small cell lung cancer.
dosage_info: 200mg intravenously every 3 weeks or 400mg every 6 weeks.

name: Cytarabine
description: A chemotherapy agent used in the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia and other blood cancers.
dosage_info: 100-200mg/m² daily for 7 days by continuous IV infusion.

name: Degarelix
description: A gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) antagonist used to treat advanced prostate cancer. It works by blocking messages from the hypothalamus that tell the pituitary gland to produce luteinising hormone, which in turn tells the testicles to produce testosterone.
dosage_info: Initial dose: 240mg administered as two 120mg injections. Maintenance dose: 80mg administered as one injection every 28 days.
side_effects: {'hot flashes','weight gain','increased liver enzymes','injection site reactions','decreased bone density'}

name: Doxorubicin
description: An anthracycline antibiotic used in chemotherapy for various cancers including breast cancer. It works by interfering with DNA replication in cancer cells.
dosage_info: 60-75mg/m² IV every 21 days or 20mg/m² IV weekly.

name: Cisplatin
description: A platinum-based chemotherapy drug used to treat various cancers including lung cancer. It works by damaging DNA and preventing cancer cells from dividing.

name: Paclitaxel
description: A taxane drug used in chemotherapy for various cancers including breast and lung cancer. It works by preventing cancer cells from dividing.
dosage_info: 175mg/m² IV over 3 hours every 3 weeks or 80mg/m² IV weekly.
side_effects: {'hair loss','numbness in hands and feet','joint pain','low blood cell counts','allergic reactions'}

name: Bicalutamide
description: An anti-androgen medication used to treat prostate cancer. It works by blocking the action of testosterone on cancer cells.
dosage_info: 50mg orally once daily (with LHRH analog) or 150mg once daily (monotherapy).
